ratings.question_text: How responsive to student comments was the instructor?
I would give the instructor of this class an overall rating of:
I would give this course an overall rating of:
Apart from how well the course was taught, how valuable is the course to students with interests similar to yours?
Did you participate in a work group as part of this course?

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-10, if you wish
comments: The lectures were very well delivered, and I appreciated that much of the goal of course was to help train students HOW to think about these issues, as much as technical training on how to go about applying economics.
New concepts and interesting insights of the professor. He was engaged during lecture, which always ran smoothly and was highly informative.
interesting topics
Very important material covered. Each subject could and should be a course in and of itself.

The provocative lectures and the discussion sections. On the latter, I wish students had been more engaged and interested in debate and dialogue, but I think the TA's did the best they could. Maybe setting a tone early that "we will be gathering at these discussion sections to go over any questions you may have from class, but also to debate and hopefully bring in current or real-world examples..."
The instructor can explain the sense very clearly.

narratives.question_text: The things about this course most in need of improvement are:
comments: More coordination between reading, problem sets, and lecture. They certainly corresponded very broadly, but they did not always serve to make each other more comprehensible and thus during exam time students seemed to be learning material solely to answer exam questions. I felt as if I was highly engaged during lecture, but that did not assist me to a great extent on the examinations.
reading material

Coverage of economics of climate change could be improved; subject treated in broad generalizations which failed to impart skills for student assessment of the issues. Breakout session for graduate students would facilitate deeper engagement of the material, more gratifying learning process, perhaps providing greater opportunity for applied analysis. Explanatory language of the homework assignments was often erroneous and/or unnecessarily confusing, which led to many hours of wasted effort over the course of the semester.

narratives.question_text: What was the availability and quality of help you received of the instructor and TA?
comments: Both parties were responsive to inquiries for assistance.
good
The help from the TAs was absolutely fantastic. Nami went above and beyond what was required of her. She was the best thing about this course.
I often worked with both TAs, attending both discussion sessions, and thought they were both fantastic.
Good on all accounts.
The TA-s were very hardworking and extremely accommodating.
The instructor and TA are all very helpful.
Both were available and helpful. Nami, my TA, was very helpful. I was a little confused on the requirements for the final paper.

narratives.question_text: Discuss if you wish how this course fits into your overall program.
comments: This course was meant to fulfill an economic analysis requirement for the International Relations degree, as my focus is on agriculture and development.
good

This class provided a very nice theoretical balance to my Forestry/MBA curriculum. Coupling this with my "Forest and Ecosystem Finance" class (very applied), I found that I was able to get a more complete understanding of what natural resource management looks like.
I hope to hear more about climate change and economics.

I think this was a helpful introduction to economics specifically related to natural resources. I am interested in taking more economics classes after this but with more of a focus on forest products and forest ecosystem services.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: In order to learn some basics of the economic side of environmental management.
related to my study interest
I came to Yale Forestry in order to expand on my science background, and economics was a major reason.
I'm very interested in Environmental Economics.

narratives.question_text: Did it live up to your expectations?
comments: The lectures certainly did, however the nature of the assignments left a little to be desired.
yes
Yes.

Yes, and I appreciated that this class (perhaps more so than the foundation Econ for Forestry) focused a lot on challenging students to think differently about some well-established wisdoms about the way weoptimally manage resources.
Yes, the class is beyond my expectation. Very informative.

narratives.question_text: Did you get out of it what you expected?
comments: Yes, for the most part.
Yes.
Yes, I did. I enjoyed lecture very much.
Yes, and the final project is very interesting.

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: Nothing toshow..

narratives.question_text: For students taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: To be ready to work independently on homework and preparation for the exams, and to make clear the responsibilities that graduate students have that are separate from undergraduates. The specifics of the paper assignment were not clear on the syllabus.

I would encourage going to every class, being alert (coffee always helped) so as to pick up the points in each lecture, and don't stress the fine points of grades. Harder to do that last bit if you're an undergrad, perhaps, but I loved the class and did not stress the grades too much.
